CatDescriptText: Annette Singleton, 8364 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958 pg 4 with question: "Should parents compel children who are still students in high school or college to work to help support the family?" answer reads: "I don't think that they should take care of the family, but they should work to help to take care of themselves.  While they are working, they should use the money to help themselves while going to school."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Annette Singleton wearing light colored hat and tweed coat with dark collar, holding handbag, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
